narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Understanding of a new, cutting-edge area of biological research from someone who has contributed significantly to the field! The experimental methods, computational scripts, applications, and pros/cons of what's going on. Each tuesday the students gave a lecture on the paper and every thursday we had computational labs to regenerate data in these papers. Extra cool to be able to work with real-world results. Also gained knowledge surrounding high performance computing.
I gained a lot of coding experience related to single cell analysis.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved engaging with the content and people in this course, and I learned so much! It definitely helped that I took some stats/comp in the past so I loved seeing the concepts applied to biology. Comp labs were well-explained. I wish we had a little more coding or other assignments throughout the semester; I didn't have a whole lot of background on bioinformatics/genetic info processing when we started and it would have been good to have a preliminary lecture on these that laid everything out.
The strength of this course was the Professor who included journal clubs and coding workshops.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! Learn about this really incredible, cutting-edge area of science from an expert. This will be one of your only opportunities. This course was so thorough without being a back breaking amount of work and I had such a positive experience. Rong is so nice and knowledgeable!
Absolutely. This course was an excellent introduction to single cell analysis.
